decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The mana base is tuned to support a balance of black and blue spells, while Wasteland provides additional disruption against opposing lands. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back with Reanimate and Animate Dead for a fast and explosive win condition. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The combination of card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and powerful threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty provides the deck with multiple avenues to victory.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast, aggressive plays using powerful creatures like Magus of the Moon and Pyrogoyf. By utilizing cards such as Chrome Mox and City of Traitors to accelerate mana production, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void. Additionally, cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption provide additional removal and reach to finish off the opponent. The strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly applying pressure to secure victory.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to accelerate its mana with cards like Eldrazi Temple and Grim Monolith to quickly play out threats like Reality Smasher and Glaring Fleshraker. It also has some land destruction elements with Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption to control the game in its favor.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. By combining cards that provide card advantage like Mishra's Bauble and powerful threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, the goal is to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle by including fetch lands and Wasteland to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck aims to quickly cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by using Show and Tell and Omniscience. It uses cards like Intuition and Cunning Wish to search for combo pieces and protect the combo with Force of Will and Veil of Summer. The deck also has various lands and cantrips to ensure consistency in drawing the combo pieces. With the ability to surprise opponents with massive creatures early in the game, this deck focuses on quickly winning the game before opponents can set up their own strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Scale Up, Berserk, and Skyclave Pick-Axe, the deck aims to pump up its creatures and deal massive amounts of damage in a short amount of time. With aggressive creatures like Akoum Hellhound, Steppe Lynx, and Tifa Lockhart, the deck can apply early pressure and force the opponent to react quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Crop Rotation allows for flexibility in searching for lands and enhancing the deck's overall strategy.
